meanings.definition: The arched middle part of the foot.
meanings.sent1: She felt pain in her insteps after wearing uncomfortable shoes.
meanings.sent2: He admired the graceful arches of her insteps.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy licked her insteps, tickling her.
meanings.sent4: The insteps of the old bridge creaked under their weight.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's strong insteps supported her elegant movements.

meanings.definition: To step or tread on the instep of.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to insteps on the toys scattered on the floor.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally insteps on her foot while dancing.
meanings.sent3: She playfully insteps on his toes during the game.
meanings.sent4: The giant's foot insteps on the tiny village below.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to insteps on sharp rocks along the trail.
